results.content:
Great course!  I was looking for something that was very hands on and showed how to use a database.  The explanations are good.

One video is out of order, which confused me.

Tutor was concise on his content yet enough for a beginner to know major about power of spring boot.

results.content: Excelente... Mostrou de forma rápida, fácil e prática.
results.content_html: Excelente... Mostrou de forma rápida, fácil e prática.

results.content:
Overall, a very good course. 

However, lesson 17 and 18 are in the incorrect order, meaning that one cannot complete lesson 17 unless one has completed the tasks in lesson 18 first. This could potentially be very confusing if one does not know what to do (luckily, I did, and then found those same tasks in the next lesson). 

And as can be seen in the Q&A-section, people have encountered problems with this over two months ago without it being fixed. It is no problem if one is aware of it, but since it is still not fixed, the course only gets four stars from me.
results.content_html:
Overall, a very good course.

However, lesson 17 and 18 are in the incorrect order, meaning that one cannot complete lesson 17 unless one has completed the tasks in lesson 18 first. This could potentially be very confusing if one does not know what to do (luckily, I did, and then found those same tasks in the next lesson).

And as can be seen in the Q&A-section, people have encountered problems with this over two months ago without it being fixed. It is no problem if one is aware of it, but since it is still not fixed, the course only gets four stars from me.

results.content: The content of the course is really basic, it doesn't shows different kind of HTTP request like Patch and another 5 more, The use of JPA is only for one entity, it would be better with the use of relations and more staff related. A plus is the use of filters in spring boot.
results.content_html: The content of the course is really basic, it doesn't shows different kind of HTTP request like Patch and another 5 more, The use of JPA is only for one entity, it would be better with the use of relations and more staff related. A plus is the use of filters in spring boot.

results.content: It's hard to understand the instructor's accent & the pace is too fast. Also, there are things somewhat out of context. JPA dependency added AFTER some annotations from it are used so it's very confusing.
